issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
TIMOB-7004 states there there is a bug in Android where relative images are not loading correctly, however it's the opposite. The images are loading in iOS when they should not be.

In TIMOB-7004 test case, {{app.js}} will {{require('ui/homeView.js')}} which creates an ImageView with a relative path. On Android, an image path of {{commonimages/home-home.png}} will try to load {{ui/commonimages/home-home.png}}. On iOS, it appears to treat relative image paths as absolute paths, which is not correct.
fields.summary: iOS: Relative images paths are not relative to Resources dir, not current JS file

comments.body:
Windows behaviour appears to match that of iOS, in that it will load the images.

Windows 10 Pro
Ti SDK:6.1.0.v20160823150730
Nokia Lumia 930 10.0

!http://puu.sh/qM0ZH/e0bcc7a1c9.jpg!
